author: lilonion4174
content: How do I dump my staked eth before the price plummets further?

author: sky.cactus
content: You cannot.  Staking is indefinite until withdraws are implemented.  This should have been made explicitly clear to you during the setup process (e.g., launchpad.ethereum.org went to great lengths to make this clear to users).

author: lilonion4174
content: Wait I can't sell the thing I own?

author: sky.cactus
content: Correct.  Once you stake you are locked in until withdraws are implemented, and then your turn in the withdraw queue comes up.

author: sky.cactus
content: If you gave your money to someone else (like a custodial exchange) and *they* then staked it, you may be able to ask them to pay out early (possibly at a discount) since you have an IOU with them, and you aren't actually a staker.

author: lilonion4174
content: Ok this js helpful info thank you
